alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 22 at 8:09AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following counties, Chase and Marion. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 AM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Up to a half inch of additional rainfall is expected over the next six hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Marion, Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Florence, Goessel, Lincolnville, Ramona, Lehigh, Tampa, Durham, Bazaar, Lost Springs, Elmdale, Cedar Point, Pilsen, Hymer, Marion Lake, Tallgrass Prairie Preserve and Tallgrass Prairie.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
